paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the His90Asn mutation in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.demographics: Two adult women, ages 56 and 51, from Italy.
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (hATTR) with neurological involvement.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Neurological symptoms including sensory ataxia, weight loss, and gastrointestinal symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient promptly started patisiran with a brilliant response at 6 and 9 months of follow-up in absence of any side effects.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Feet burning sensation, leg cramps, and subjective loss of balance.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: After 12 months of treatment, the neurological examination showed improvement in the distal leg weakness.

functional_data.summary: The His90Asn mutation is associated with hATTR phenotype, but its pathogenic role is debated.

variants.segregation_data: The same mutation was found in two twins and four sisters, all unaffected.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and response to treatment.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of the His90Asn mutation appears to be incomplete, with some carriers remaining asymptomatic.
key_quotes: All carriers of His90Asn mutation have been followed for about two years, and they still have no sign or symptoms of hATTR.
The connection of this mutation with the phenotype is confirmed by the presence of amyloid deposits in the salivary glands in one case.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
